shortcontents.shortcontent:
I)Introduction (fols. 1ra-11vb) - Mäqdǝmä wängel “Introduction to the Gospels” (fols. 1ra-6vb) - Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 6vb-7rb) - Canon tables (fols. 7va-11ra) - On the reliability of the Gospels (fol. 11va-vb) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 1va-64vb) - Biography of Matthew (fol. 11va-vb) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 14ra-64vb) - Postscript (fol. 64vb) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 64va-99ra) - Biography of Mark (fols. 64va-65ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fol. 65ra-vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 68ra-98vb) - Postscript (fol. 99ra) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 99ra-157ra) - Biography of Luke (fol. 99rb-va), preceded by a prayer (fol. 99ra-rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 83 titles (fols. 99va-100vb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 103ra-157ra) - Postscript (fol. 157ra) V) Gospel of John (fols. 157ra-201ra) - Biography of John (fols. 157ra-158ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 20 titles (fol. 158ra-rb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 160ra-200vb) - Postscript (fol. 201ra)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: ʾAfä Krǝstos (mentioned in supplication formulas, cp. fols. 14r, l.3; 64rb, l.16, etc.).

dcomments.dcomment: Late 18th or early 19th century. Quires III, X, XV, XII, with miniatures, were added much later (second half of the 20th cent.).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire:
I(6/fols. 1r-6v) – II(5; s. l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 7r-11v) – ˂III(2/fols. 12r-13v)˃ – IV(9; s. l.: 3, stub after 7/fols. 14r-22v) – ፬V(9; s. l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 23r-31v) – ፫VI(10/fols. 32r-41v) – ፬VII(10/fols. 42r-51v) – ፭VIII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – ፮IX(6; s. l.: 2, 5, stubs after 1, 4/fols. 60r-65v) – ˂X(2/fols. 66r-67v)˃ – XI(10/fols. 68r-77v) – XII(8/fols. 78r-85v) – XIII(9; s. l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 86r-94v) – XIV(6/fols. 95r-100v) – ˂XV(2/fols. 101r-102v)˃ – XVI(6/fols. 103r-108v) – XVII(10/fols. 109r-118v) – XVIII(10/fols. 119r-128v) – XIX(10/fols. 129r-138v) – XX(10/fols. 139r-148v) – XXI(10/fols. 149r-158v) – ˂XXII(1/fol. 159)˃ – XXIII(10/fols. 160r-169v) – XXIV(10/fols. 170r-179v) – XXV(8/fols. 180r-187v) – XXVI(8/fols. 188r-195v) – XXVII(6; s. l.: 1, 2, stubs after 6 (2)/fols. 196r-201v)
Quires III, X, XV, XII (binions or singletons), with the miniatures, were added much later (second half of the 20th cent.?). Quires V-VIII have been numbered incorrectly. The number for quire IV has been erased. The rest of the quires lack numbering.

taunit.cl-info: Canon tables in fols. 8r-10v are written in 3 columns.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible (s. fol. 35r). Ruling pricks are visible (s. fol. 37r). Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 21v-22r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the Introduction and the Canon tables.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; chapter numbers and the word mǝˤǝraf; incipits of Gospel chapters and of minor texts (two initial lines); some of the marginal notes repeating chapter titles or indicating the liturgical occasions on which given sections should be read; name of the donor; parts of the Canon tables; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the Ethiopic numbers indicating the “tituli”.
Incipits of Text I and of each of the four Gospels are written alternately in red and black lines (s. fols. 1r, 14r, 68r, 103r, 160r).

otherdetails.otherdetail:
In Text I, Mäqdǝmä wängel is incomplete, the final part of the seventh and the entire eighth "periods of instruction" missing. For details s. R.W. COWLEY, “New Testament Introduction in the Andemta Commentary Tradition”, Ostkirchliche Studien 26, 1977, 144-92; here esp. 160-2; R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, Part I: General Introduction, Part II: Edition of the Gospel of Mark, Stuttgart, 1989 (AeF 27), 6-36. The "Biography of Matthew" is merged with the part "On the reliability of the Gospels". Additional leaves with miniatures were infixed in the recent time, to "illuminate" the Ms. Decorated quire marks.
The Golden Gospel of ʾAmbäsät Kidanä Mǝḥrät church.

additional.cont: Fol. 201ra-rb: Record concerning a land dispute in the court.
additional.det: In Amharic. Dated Ḫǝdar 3, 1932 E.C. (= Monday, November 13, 1939 A.D.). Signed by ʾaläqa Zäwgä and ʾato Täwäldä.

extras.extra: - Fols. 28v, 71v, 87r, 98r, 122r, 155r, 160v, 192r, 199r, 199v (in the upper margin): Crude notes. - Fols. 106r, 145r, 156v, 186r, 193v (in the upper margin): Elaborately written notes indicating the topic of the corresponding chapter or the liturgical occasion. - Fol. 156r (in the upper margin): Note, half-erased. - Fol. 160v (in the left-hand margin): Number ፱, crudely written. - Fol. 178r (in the upper margin): Note, in bright-red ink. - Fols. 190r, 193r (in the upper margin): Crude notes, hardly legible. - In the Gospel of Matthew, first folios of the quires are inscribed (in the upper margin) with the name of the Evangelist (s. fols. 23r, 32r, 42r, 52r, 60r). - Decorated quire marks.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the upper left margin of fols. 14r, 23r, 32r, 42r, 52r, 60r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Many notes in the upper margin referring to the content of the Ms. - Coloured threads have been inserted in the upper and outer margins of fols. 18, 19, 46, 87, 155.

miniature.info: Fol. 11v: Christ crowned with thorns, donor.
miniature.details: Frontispiece miniature; recent; the name of the donor missing.

miniature.info: Fol. 12r: ʾAbunä Libanos and ʾabunä ʾArägawi
Fol. 13r: The Holy Trinity, two donors.
Fol. 67r: The Virgin Mary with her Child.

drawing.info: Fol. 160v: Crude drawing of a cross.
Fol. 161v: Crude drawing of a cross.
Fol. 185v: Drawing of a human eye.
